section_title: Total hip resurfacing (Evidence: pg no: 25, L870)
names: Total hip resurfacing (Evidence: pg no: 25, L870)
Total hip resurfacing arthroplasty (HRA) (Evidence: pg no: 25, L871)
description: Total hip resurfacing arthroplasty (HRA) is considered medically necessary when ALL of the following criteria are met. (Evidence: pg no: 25, L871-L872)
scope: This guideline addresses hip arthroplasty when performed as an elective, non-emergent procedure and not as part of the care of an acute fracture (excluding fracture of implant and periprosthetic fracture). (Evidence: pg no: 22, L756-L757)

documentation: Active, fit individual (Evidence: pg no: 25, L873)
Normal proximal femoral bone geometry and bone quality (Evidence: pg no: 25, L874)
Otherwise eligible for a conventional primary total hip replacement (THR) (Evidence: pg no: 25, L875-L883)
Likely to outlive a current conventional total hip replacement (Evidence: pg no: 25, L884)

exclusions: Known metal hypersensitivity (Evidence: pg no: 25, L889)
Inadequate bone stock to support the femoral implant (Evidence: pg no: 25, L890)
Femoral neck or head cysts (Evidence: pg no: 25, L891)
Severe hip dysplasia (Evidence: pg no: 25, L892)
Small or bone-deficient acetabulum (Evidence: pg no: 25, L893)

codes.description: Metal-on-metal total hip resurfacing, including acetabular and femoral components (Evidence: pg no: 27, L979)
